nodes.text: Madonna was an individual who, without invitation, attended one of Quenk jazz artist Mrp-Mrp Poo's annual Vector Day parties at the Boulderdash terrarium. Madonna was later cited by journalist Dyslogia Twang when he chronicled the events that happened at the gala in "Sightings by Twang," a social gossip column.

Madonna was mentioned in a two-page segment titled "Sightings by Twang," written by Bob Carrau for the 1993 book Monsters and Aliens from George Lucas, a publication that combines creature designs and photographs from various projects of George Lucas, creator of the Star Wars franchise, with original text by Carrau. Lucasfilm employee Leland Chee, who maintains the Holocron continuity database, has indicated that information contained in the book is non-canonical. Madonna's gender and species were left unspecified in the book.
